result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with J.A.G.

ADA Diaz appears in person for the state. Defendant appears in person, in custody from Dodge Correctional. Attorney Kuczynski appears in person. Defense advised pleading to amended count. PSI requested. State complied with VRL. State makes motion to amend. Court grants motion to amend. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant KVI waives all rights and enters G plea to amended count. PSI ordered. SEH set. Bond cont.
Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum

ADDRESS INFO for Chad Justin Stai

Prior: N19788 Schmickle Valley Rd, Trempealeau, WI 54661
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion and Order to Allow Defendant to Appear Remotely

3:30 PM ADA Diaz appears in person for the state. Defendant does not appear. Attorney Kuczynski appears in person. Defense advised order for transport was not completed, defendant was moved to prison in July. Defense requesting to reschedule and for defendant to appear remotely as he does not wish to be transported. State has no objection. Court grants remote appearance. Court advised of prints and signed bond needing to be completed. ADA Diaz advised will contact sheriff's dept. to work on getting prints. PLEAS set. Bond cont.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with J.A.G.

Defendant can hear/see okay, okay appearing by video, received no threats/promises to appear by video. Court finds def KVI waives personal appearance. Attorney Kuczynski advised defendant waives reading of information and enters NG pleas. PTC/PLEAS set.

Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. Atty Kuczynski states def waives reading of information and enters NG plea. PTC/PLEAS set. Bond to continue.

9:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chad Justin Stai appeared by video, in custody from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski appeared by phone for Chad Justin Stai. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant waives reading of complaint. SIBS.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
